title: 2016 AMC 12B Problem 25
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Large  a_0 = 1, a_1 = \sqrt[19]{2}, \\
\Large a_n = a_{n-1} \times a_{n-2} ^2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider a sequence defined recursively for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n\geq 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the above manner."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the smallest positive integer value "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that the product "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{1}a_{2}\dotsm a_k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer? "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the whole set:  2016 AMC 12B Problems."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                    "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relevant wiki: Induction - Recurrence Relations","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First, you start with the first part of the sequence: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,\quad \sqrt[19]{2},\quad \sqrt[19]{2},\quad \sqrt[19]{2^3}\dotsm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"That's too much to write (for most of us, at least). If you keep going on, the exponent inside the square root is going to get larger and larger. Let's convert this to exponential form."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^0,\quad 2^{\frac{1}{19}},\quad 2^{\frac{1}{19}},\quad 2^{\frac{3}{19}},\quad 2^{\frac{5}{19}}\dotsm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Still too much to write for most of us. Let's drop out the 2 and list only the exponents. And let's drop out the first term, because we don't need it anyway."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Multiply the exponents by 19 while you're at it. After all this, we get the sequence of:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,\quad 1,\quad 3,\quad 5,\quad 11,\quad 21,\quad 43,\quad 85,\quad \dotsm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To see how many terms of the sequence we need to multiply to get an integer, you must add that many terms of the sequence above and check whether it is divisible by 19. Given the answer choices, you should find out 15 of the terms before you start doing that."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equations for finding the next terms are:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2a_{n}+1=a_{n+1}\quad"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\in"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the set of all odd numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2a_{n}-1=a_{n+1}\quad"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\in"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the set of all even numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To find the sum of all terms before that, use these equations:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum \limits_{i=1}^{n} = 2a_{n}-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\in"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the set of all odd numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum \limits_{i=1}^{n} = 2a_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\in"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the set of all even numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, we can find the terms of this sequence up to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{20}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,\quad 1,\quad 3,\quad 5,\quad 11,\quad 21,\quad 43,\quad 85,\quad 171,\quad 341,\quad 683,\quad 1365,\quad 2731,\quad 5461,\quad 10923, \\ 21825,\quad 43651,\quad 87301,\quad 174603,\quad 349205"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The sum of the first 15 terms is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2(10923)-1 = 21825"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is NOT divisible by 19. (The divisibility rule for 19 is to add two times the digit [opposite of 7, which is to subtract] to the remaining number)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The sum of the first 16 terms is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2(21825) = 43650"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is NOT divisible by 19 (as you saw in the last example)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The sum of the first 17 terms is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2(43651)-1 = 87301"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which IS divisible by 19."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, 17 is the smallest positive integer, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I too did the same way ;) Cheers.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I found it hard to read that the root was 19. I thought it was 10. As such, I've edited the formulas to make them easier to read.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 2016 AMC (Sample Question)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a positive integer. Bernado and Silvia take turns writing and erasing numbers on a blackboard as follows: Bernardo starts by writing the smallest perfect square with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits. Every time Bernardo writes a number, Silvia erases the last "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits of it. Bernardo then writes the next perfect square, Silvia erases the last "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits of it, and this process continues until the last two numbers that remain on the board differ by at least 2. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(k) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the smallest positive integer not written on the board. For example, if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the numbers that Bernardo writes are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16,25,36,49,64"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and the numbers showing on the board after Silvia erases are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,2,3,4,5,6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1) = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". What is the sum of digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(2) + f(4) + f(6) + \\cdots + f(2016) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/GG8nodwPud-capture.JPG?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"text","text":"Therefore each f(k) adds 2 + 5 + 1 = 8 to the sum of the digits. Since 2n = 2016, n = 1008, and *8n = 8064*","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2016 and factorial

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We consider two cases. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 1","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m \leq 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This gives us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cases to check and shows the only solution to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7!+2016=7056=84^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 2","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m \geq 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m \geq 8 \implies 64 \vert m! \implies m!=64 k \quad k \in  \mathbb{N} \quad \quad \color{#3D99F6}{\text{As } (2 \times 4 \times 8) \vert 8!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m!+2016=64k+2016=16(4k+126)=\left (4^2 \right) \left (4k+126 \right) \implies 4k+126=n^2 \quad n \in \mathbb{N}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n^2 \equiv 0 \text{ or } 1 \pmod{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4k+126 \equiv 2 \pmod{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which is a contradiction so there are no solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m \geq 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This means the only solution is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" giving the sum of the perfect squares as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900}{\boxed{\boxed{7056}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Sam Bealing"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/sam-xf6opm/"}]},{"type":"text","text":" WHOAH!!!! This method is waaayyy shorter than mine!!! I worked mod 19 and restricted myself to 18 huge cases!!! +1 for this!!!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m!+2016=n^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a positive integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m\le 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" it is easy to check that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the unique solution. In that case, we have: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7!+2016=7056=84^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m\ge8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m!+2016\equiv 32\ (\bmod{64})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", cannot be a perfect square."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
